poem:
Oodles of Lucys in the Sun

In thrumming suburbs,  
the pulse of paws—  
each Lucy  
a wagging shadow  
under eucalyptus,  
gifts exchanged  
like promises,  
Aussie voices linger  
on the breeze,  
songs for the silent  
companions—  
their names echo  
like ripples  
in this vast,  
furry sea.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Oodles of Lucys: survey reveals Australia’s most popular dog breeds and names Almost three-quarters of Australian households own a pet, new research shows, with dogs retaining their dominant position as the country’s most popular extended family member. The triennial Animal Medicines Australia 2025 survey shows owners now regularly give pets presents on special occasions, cook for them, leave the television or radio on for them, take time off work to care for them and bring". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
